intro: Heterotheca rosei, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive blue to purple petals. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its narrow, gray-green leaves and showy blue flowers make it a striking addition to xeriscaped gardens. Heterotheca rosei is also valued for its ecological role, providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
